intro.description:
A Screen Class allows to identify a page (or screen) of a Web application. Convertigo uses the Screen Class to determine which extraction rules to use for a given page. A Screen Class is identified uniquely or by one or more Criteria based on Xpath
expressions
Collect in the web site all of the page type containing data as well as those passed to reach them. These pages have to be « marked » as Screen Class so that Convertigo knows at each moment in which page it is.
The bold text in this help file is available in (?).

item.title: Put the browser
item.description: Put the browser area(in the Connector view) on one of the preceeding pages.

item.title: Find a specific element
item.description:
Click right on an element in the browser area which looks like a specific element of the page or type of page(example: a name, an iamage, a button).
In the DOM Area (containing the HTML code under the form of a tree), an underlined element appears in green

item.title: Define a specific element
item.description:
In the DOM Area, press on the "+" of the green element. In the deployed list find an attribute or a tag characterising the screen type of the actual screen (exemple : attribute « id »,attribute « name »). Click right on this last and press on « Generate selection Xpath ».
In the zone Xpath Area , an Xpath request appears. The field XPath's result Area shows the results of the Xpath request for the actual page.
(You can press the icon parent node icon to go back in the hierarchy of the DOM Area to find a better element to characterise the web page)

item.title: Verify the exclusivity of your request
item.description:
Verify that the Xpath request of the Xpath area doesn't return results for this screen.
For this, test the Xpath request on all the other web pages that are or will become a Screen class. Confirm that they will not sent anything back (root only in XPath's result Area).
If this is the case return to the web page web to be defined and go to the next phase. If not find an other Xpath request by clicking right -->« Generate selection Xpath » or by manually modifying the request in the zone Xpath Area.

item.title: Execute the creation
item.description:
In the view Projects view, click on Screen class « Default Screen class ».
Then click on the icon new screen class icon . Select "Screen class", press next and give a name to your screen class.
(You can also click on the icon new criteria icon to enrich a screen class already existing with a new criteria. The screen class selected in the tab Projects view must be the screen class to be enriched. If there are multiple criteria for a screen class, then all have to be satisfied)

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: Your screen class is created and appears in the tab Projects view. Now you can create other screen classes.
